alert.note: Alert for Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:44PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Granville, northwestern Wake and southeastern Durham Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 543 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over RDU International, or 8 miles northwest of Raleigh, moving northeast at 20 mph. This storm has a history of producing 1 inch hail over Morrisville. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Creedmoor, Wake Forest, Butner, RDU International, Morrisville, Falls Lake State Rec Area and William B Umstead State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
